intro: Mespilodaphne pulchella var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common mespilodaphne, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
